intro: Oreoherzogia, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to the arid regions of Southwestern North America. These plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Oreoherzogia species are typically low-growing shrubs or herbs, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They play an important role in their ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The genus is named in honor of the botanist Hermann Herzog, reflecting its significance in botanical research.
